Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern üôå #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/M5LzxjUZNu

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

@LoveNorthum @EnvAgencyAnglia @jamesowild @WildTroutTrust @N_Rivers_Trust @WNGreens @JamesBevanEA @TheLynnNews Caught in the act of trying to cover up the fact the bund had failed probably thought he could intimidate me the wind was too strong for sound but plenty of abuse ü§£ü§£ü§£

Our beautiful rivers are in crisis. Recent @EnvAgency data showed none of England's rivers are in good overall health üò®
We're grateful to all our volunteers who dedicate time to helping our rivers, but we need more govt. regulation to combat this crisis #WorldRiversDay üëä https://t.co/6MZ0vxjiXq

This #WorldRiversDay is more important than ever. Last week @EnvAgency figures revealed that 0% of rivers and lakes in England are classed as in good health. ZERO. 

It‚Äôs never been more crucial to support action for natures recovery üëâ https://t.co/zup3vrsuz7 #WilderFuture https://t.co/ll0pdflpI9

To celebrate #WorldRiversDay #TeamEA are highlighting our work in partnership with @EdenRiversTrust & @networkrail in Thrimby An 800m channel realignment project that will not only provide benefits to fish and other wildlife but also reduce flood risk to the West Coast Main Line. https://t.co/FwwebMtf9o

@EnvAgency woefully inadequate regulation, aside if you‚Äôre going to spend our money on PR films, please at least share meaningful information that actually helps people make a difference. This is pap.

When mature trees get in the way of construction projects in Singapore, they just move them.

If you really value green infrastructure, there is another way.

https://t.co/WgZ4bGwQZk
@PJennings88 @AquiferChalk @EnvAgency How would we know if our local river is an orphan?

Today is #WorldRiversDay. In Yorkshire & the North East we're blessed with many beautiful rivers and streams. In Yorks we've got a number projects helping to restore rivers: DNAire, Ryevitalise, Salmon to South Yorks, Doing More For The Derwent. https://t.co/yEj4KQUo78

tweets.text: @EnvAgency How many of those incidents could you have stopped happening in the first place if you simply enforced existing regulations? Axe that huge tranche of mid-high management and get more people back on the ground. Act as a regulator not some weak industry conscience.

@gow_derek What a prospect for @EnvAgency to consider - sturgeon once again spawning on clean gravel-beds, below the crystal-clear Humber tributaries of the Ure, Swale, Ouse, Wharf, Trent, etc.; joining sea lamprey as an increasingly abundant species . . . . What a thought @gow_derek üôèüëç

A big surge in rivers being adopted by pressure groups. If you know of an orphaned river take it under your wings. The good people at @AquiferChalk are creating a tool kit for you. We need more of you because the @EnvAgency under current senior management are useless.
@EnvAgency Even the right wing press are unimpressed https://t.co/TiHlQGmti4
